thread.title: Utes storm past ASU: Storylines and Takeaways
thread.title_full: Utes storm past ASU: Storylines and Takeaways

title: Utes storm past ASU: Storylines and Takeaways
text:
Utes storm past ASU: Storylines and Takeaways The Utes got the better of ASU on Saturday night, and now control the Pac-12 South. Post to Facebook Utes storm past ASU: Storylines and Takeaways The Utes got the better of ASU on Saturday night, and now control the Pac-12 South.   12news.com: http://12ne.ws/1RPaT1f   Join the Conversation To   Utes storm past ASU: Storylines and Takeaways Robby Baker , 12 Sports 11:12 p.m. MST October 17, 2015 The Utes got the better of ASU on Saturday night, and now control the Pac-12 South. Oct 17, 2015; Salt Lake City, UT, USA; Utah Utes tight end Siale Fakailoatonga (87) runs after a reception as Arizona State Sun Devils defensive back Jordan Simone (38) and linebacker Salamo Fiso (58) move in for the tackle during the first quarter at Rice-Eccles Stadium. Fakailoatonga was injured on the play. Mandatory Credit: Russ Isabella-USA TODAY Sports (Photo: Russ Isabella-USA TODAY Sports) 
The fourth ranked Utah Utes beat the Arizona State Sun Devils 34-18 in Salt Lake City. 
Same old song and dance 
Did Arizona State pull off the greatest illusion of 2015 when they beat UCLA? 
Somehow they convinced all of us they had exercised their demons and were ready to be the Pac-12 contenders we thought they were preseason. 
Well they aren't. 
This isn't a gut reaction to Saturday night's loss in Salt Lake City, it's the harsh truth. Oct 17, 2015; Salt Lake City, UT, USA; Arizona State Sun Devils quarterback Mike Bercovici (2) passes the ball during the first quarter against the Utah Utes at Rice-Eccles Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Russ Isabella-USA TODAY Sports Russ Isabella-USA TODAY Sports Fullscreen Oct 17, 2015; Salt Lake City, UT, USA; Utah Utes tight end Siale Fakailoatonga (87) runs after a reception as Arizona State Sun Devils defensive back Jordan Simone (38) and linebacker Salamo Fiso (58) move in for the tackle during the first quarter at Rice-Eccles Stadium. Fakailoatonga was injured on the play. Mandatory Credit: Russ Isabella-USA TODAY Sports Russ Isabella-USA TODAY Sports Fullscreen Oct 17, 2015; Salt Lake City, UT, USA; Arizona State Sun Devils defensive back Solomon Means (7) breaks up a pass intended for Utah Utes tight end Caleb Repp (47) during the first quarter at Rice-Eccles Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Russ Isabella-USA TODAY Sports Russ Isabella-USA TODAY Sports Fullscreen Oct 17, 2015; Salt Lake City, UT, USA; Utah Utes wide receiver Kenneth Scott (2) runs after a reception as Arizona State Sun Devils cornerback Lloyd Carrington (8) defends during the first quarter at Rice-Eccles Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Russ Isabella-USA TODAY Sports Russ Isabella-USA TODAY Sports Fullscreen Oct 17, 2015; Salt Lake City, UT, USA; Utah Utes quarterback Travis Wilson (7) hands off to running back Devontae Booker (23) during the first half against the Arizona State Sun Devils at Rice-Eccles Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Russ Isabella-USA TODAY Sports Russ Isabella-USA TODAY Sports Oct 17, 2015; Salt Lake City, UT, USA; Utah Utes fans cheer during the first half against the Arizona State Sun Devils at Rice-Eccles Stadium. Mandatory Credit: Russ Isabella-USA TODAY Sports Russ Isabella-USA TODAY Sports Fullscreen Oct 17, 2015; Salt Lake City, UT, USA; Arizona State Sun Devils quarterback Mike Bercovici (2) hands off to running back Kalen Ballage (9) during the first half against the Utah Utes at Rice-Eccles Stadium.
